title: Audit beads SQLite→Dolt migration fidelity: are issues migrated with full history
description: Read upstream migration code to verify what is migrated from SQLite to Dolt (issues, dependencies, events, comments, metadata, timeline fidelity).
notes: Reviewed upstream migration code in /tmp/beads-upstream-20260224. Findings: migration imports issues+labels+dependencies+events from SQLite, but does not preserve full history semantics. (1) It creates a single Dolt commit at migration time (cmd/bd/migrate_dolt.go:121-124), so pre-migration version/commit history is not reconstructable in Dolt history. (2) events are imported from events table only (cmd/bd/migrate_shim.go:279-303, cmd/bd/migrate_dolt.go:332-354) with no ORDER BY, then iterated via map in importer (cmd/bd/migrate_import.go:181-189), so strict event ordering is not guaranteed. (3) issue metadata JSON is not selected/inserted in migration SQL (cmd/bd/migrate_shim.go:206-237, cmd/bd/migrate_import.go:101-123). (4) dependency metadata/thread_id are not selected/imported (cmd/bd/migrate_shim.go:261-264, cmd/bd/migrate_import.go:169-172).

title: Clarify local vs server chunks in WebRTC monitor to prevent 'chunks disappeared after refresh' confusion
description: Current monitor mixes locally buffered chunks and server-persisted chunks without explicit state. During incidents users see chunks in monitor, refresh page, then only persisted chunks remain and interpret as data loss. Add explicit states (local pending / uploaded / failed), persist pending list snapshot in sessionStorage for diagnostics, and show recovery hint when refresh drops non-uploaded local chunks.

title: Add diagnostics for upload failures when backend restarts (socket/upload correlation)
description: Add explicit instrumentation for /api/voicebot/upload_audio failures and client-visible fetch errors: (1) include request correlation id in frontend upload error toast and backend logs, (2) log upload attempt start/end with chunk filename+size+session_id, (3) emit client event when request aborted by network/backend restart, (4) dashboard query for 111 upstream connect failures and PM2 restarts around same window. This is needed to quickly triage incidents like session 699d7addc978d2bf5de4bc84.
